item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:49, topic:452171”]You have been in the Olympics a half century more than China, and they beat you last time and are in the lead now.
I never claimed that more people meant more medal, I just claimed that with more people you would naturally have more talents.

I’m only counting Summer Olympics here, as they give a lot more medals.
USSR has on average 44 Gold medals per game.
USA has on average 37 Gold medals per game.
China has on average 20 Gold medals per game.

That is the top 3 gold medal winner if you look at gold per game. Two of them are superpowers and the third will soon be. All of them have a big population. So I don’t see where I’m wrong.[/quote]

Implying China isn’t already a bigger global player than the U.S.

Read full topic

item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You have been in the Olympics a half century more than China, and they beat you last time and are in the lead now.
I never claimed that more people meant more medal, I just claimed that with more people you would naturally have more talents.

I’m only counting Summer Olympics here, as they give a lot more medals.
USSR has on average 44 Gold medals per game.
USA has on average 37 Gold medals per game.
China has on average 20 Gold medals per game.

That is the top 3 gold medal winner if you look at gold per game. Two of them are superpowers and the third will soon be. All of them have a big population. So I don’t see where I’m wrong.

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:47, topic:452171”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=555054.msg4068181#msg4068181 date=1344100919]
We kick ass in Summer Olympics.
[/quote]
Fixed.
You and China only kicks ass there because you are a lot of people. If we had compared medals per capita (Yes, unfair), the case would be somewhat different.[/quote]

Uhh, we kick ass in all Olympics in total.

en.wikipedia.org

All-time Olympic Games medal table

The all-time medal table for all Olympic Games from 1896 to 2018, including Summer Olympic Games, Winter Olympic Games, and a combined total of both, is tabulated below. These Olympic medal counts do not include the 1906 Intercalated Games which are no longer recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) as official Games. The IOC itself does not publish all-time tables, and publishes unofficial tables only per single Games. This table was thus compiled by adding up single entries from ...

2,500+ total medals. If we went by population density: India, China and Russia would be #1. USA only has 300 million as opposed to China’s billion.

Plus Americans pay more attention to Summer Olympics so obviously our Winter Olympics aren’t going to be AS great.

Read full topic

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:43, topic:452171”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=555054.msg4067183#msg4067183 date=1343999821]

America is the greatest which is why so many people hate us, it’s like hating the popular kids in high school who are getting all the pussy.

Who likes you beside UK? You doesn’t sound that popular.
[/quote]Aaaargh, stop using you as a replacement for America, it’s confusing at times.[/quote]
You must just live with it, it would be more confusing if I did the opposite, and even more if I did both at the same time.

I found some data for America that shows how unpopular you are: http://www.globescan.com/images/images/pressreleases/bbc2012_country_ratings/2012_bbc_country%20rating%20final%20080512.pdf
(See, even more confusing, so be happy that I don’t do that).

So this conclude that America is not one of the popular kids, and you are not the nerdy gang of DPRK, Pakistan and Iran. So America is pretty average popular. So why claim that people hate US for being popular?

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“pro banana, post:40, topic:452171”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=555054.msg4066902#msg4066902 date=1343961785]

Also saying that countries are dependent of the USA is total bullshit it’s true that we trade alot with the USA but if the USA would close it’s export and import we would start making more agreements with Asia and that’s already happening anyway.

The U.S. does not have to do any trading to make money, because the entire world trades in USD and the only place to get USD is from the U.S.

Until the world uses a different currency for trading the entire world depends on the U.S. T
[/quote]

What? If I’m getting this right you mean to say that let’s say a German company want’s to make a deal with a Japanese company they are going to convert their currency like this? euro -> usd -> yen?[/quote]

Yep. That’s why goods are MUCH cheaper in the US than in other countries.

en.wikipedia.org

Reserve currency

A reserve currency (or anchor currency) is a currency that is held in significant quantities by governments and institutions as part of their foreign exchange reserves. The reserve currency is commonly used in international transactions, international investments and all aspects of the global economy. It is often considered a hard currency or safe-haven currency. People who live in a country that issues a reserve currency can purchase imports and borrow across borders more cheaply than people in ...

The euro will most likely take over though. Europeans are sick of being in the shadow of the US.

Read full topic

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:32, topic:452171”][quote author=pro banana link=topic=555054.msg4066210#msg4066210 date=1343916369]
Also saying that countries are dependent of the USA is total bullshit it’s true that we trade alot with the USA but if the USA would close it’s export and import we would start making more agreements with Asia and that’s already happening anyway.
[/quote]
The U.S. does not have to do any trading to make money, because the entire world trades in USD and the only place to get USD is from the U.S.

Until the world uses a different currency for trading the entire world depends on the U.S. T[/quote]

What? If I’m getting this right you mean to say that let’s say a German company want’s to make a deal with a Japanese company they are going to convert their currency like this? euro -> usd -> yen?

However you are right that the usd is the standard of currency and that we compare our currency with the usd currency because it’s a strong one. And to be honnest I don’t see anything else taking it’s place on that spot. The euro had a chance but there’s a small possibility that the euro won’t exist within a few years (Crisis in Spain).
However If the USA starts another chain of economic crisises in the few years than I can see the yuan taking over that number one spot.

This is just speculation we can never be sure what’s going to happen.
Also I only had a few economic lessons, I’m no expert, just giving my opinion on these matters.

Read full topic

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

The USD’s rule will not last forever. From what I found China and Russia has/will start to trade with their own currencies. Nobody needs your paper money, countries could easily leave your currency and start to trade with Euros, Yens, Yuans, Rubles or whatever they want. You cannot invade Russia, Japan, EU or China to enforce your will.

If you cannot realize that good thing doesn’t last forever, you’re gonna have a bad time.

Read full topic

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

In my eyes there’s no such thing as the “greatest country” in the end every country has it’s problems sure some are better then others for example I live in belgium and we have social insurance for “everyone” and the average man/woman has wealthy income but our goverment is broke. We didn’t have a goverment for 541 days but it didn’t affect the people at all why? Because Belgium doesn’t rely alot on our goverment like some other countries.

Also saying that countries are dependent of the USA is total bullshit it’s true that we trade alot with the USA but if the USA would close it’s export and import we would start making more agreements with Asia and that’s already happening anyway.

My only problem with the USA is their ignorance. Thinking you’re the greatest will most likely be your downfall, History repeats itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Bowser jr:

Jmood: Their share is great and hard to replace, and then you must remember the amount of US debt that China owns. My point was however to show that US was dependent of other countries. So what is your point?

The only reason we even need to trade other countries is because we tax businesses so high that they leave.

Now to stop all this which country is better bull shit, no country is better then another. They all have problems some larger then others, but you cannot just look at the problems you have to also look at all the good things the country offers. But then still you cannot judge which country is better unless you have lived in every single one. But then still you cannot judge which country is better, because you will always be biased.

Read full topic

item.title: Food for your brain
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Jmood: Their share is great and hard to replace, and then you must remember the amount of US debt that China owns. My point was however to show that US was dependent of other countries. So what is your point?

EDIT I: While Canadian-US trade is very equal when it comes to the import/export ratio, US import most stuff from China and doesn’t export that much to them.

EDIT II: “List of countries by external debt” isn’t what you should be looking at.

EDIT III: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states_by_current_account_balance is the droids stats you are looking for.

Read full topic
